interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Day After [DVD]
Review Date: 2017/04/03
Store: Jason Robards  (Actor),     JoBeth Williams  (Actor),     Nicholas Meyer  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Action & Adventure
Product Description: ['The countdown has begun! Against the real-life backdrop of the U.S. deployment of WMDs in Europe during the escalating Cold War, this "dramatically involving [and] agonizingly graphic film" (The Hollywood Reporter) about nuclear holocaust detonated a direct hit into the heartland of America.Starring Jason Robards, JoBeth Williams, Steven Guttenberg, John Cullum and John Lithgow, this "controversial, potent drama" (Leonard Maltin) remains "one of the most talked-about programs in history"(Newsweek)! When Cold War tensions reach the ultimate boiling point, the inhabitants of a small town in Kansas learn along with the rest of America that they have fewer than 30 minutes before 300 Soviet warheads begin to appear overhead! Can anyone survive this ultimate nightmare...or the nuclear winter that is sure to follow?']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Drama', 'Format': 'Color, DVD, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Steve Guttenberg, Amy Madigan, JoBeth Williams, Georgann Johnson, John Lithgow, Jason Robards, Edward Hume, Bibi Besch, Jeff East, Calvin Jung, Lori Lethin, Nicholas Meyer, William Allen Young, John CullumSteve Guttenberg, Amy Madigan, JoBeth Williams, Georgann Johnson, John Lithgow, Jason Robards, Edward Hume, Bibi Besch, Jeff East, Calvin Jung, Lori Lethin, Nicholas Meyer, William Allen Young, John Cullum   See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 1.0)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 7 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Director': 'Nicholas Meyer', 'Media Format': 'Color, DVD, Full Screen, NTSC', 'Run time': '2 hours and 7 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 18, 2004', 'Actors': 'Jason Robards, JoBeth Williams, Steve Guttenberg, John Cullum, John Lithgow', 'Studio': 'MGM (Video & DVD)', 'Writers': 'Edward Hume', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: I was a teenager when this came out. My folks let me stay up to watch it. Scared the crap out of me. Nuclear War was my boogie man, it kept me up at night.
Review Title: Scared the crap out of me.
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Can anyone survive this ultimate nightmare...or the nuclear winter that is sure to follow?']

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Primary Interest Area:** Movies, particularly dramatic narratives focused on historical or intense themes.
- **Key Themes:** Nuclear war, Cold War tensions, survival scenarios.
- **Emotional Engagement:** Strong emotional response to narratives involving fear and existential threats.
- **Content Format Preference:** Prefers DVDs and classic media formats.
- **Ratings Tendencies:** Values impactful storytelling, reflected in a high rating for emotional resonance.
- **Nostalgia Factor:** Personal connections to content from youth influence preferences, indicating a tendency towards nostalgic recollections in viewing choices. 
- **Genre Affinity:** Drama and action-adventure, especially those that tackle serious societal issues.
  
This user appreciates films that evoke strong feelings, particularly fear related to real-world issues, and exhibits a fondness for older films that have a cultural or historical significance.
